campaign.story:
Anitons is an open world monster-collecting RPG. It’s also our dream game and would be more than pleased to deliver it to you! We, as monster taming genre fans, want to make something unique and never seen before. Take a look at Anitons early gameplay footage:
Anitons is an open world monster-collecting RPG where you start your adventure in the wilderness, fight wild Anitons, and collect your own unique Anitons. Every Aniton you obtain can help you fight and farm. Expand your base to fit all monsters in your collection - decorate walls and place bamboo sticks to make Pangeros feel at home. Happy and well-fed Aniton will fight better and help you gather resources. Catch every known Aniton, battle other players, build the biggest farm or just get lost in a world full of life!
Features:
Explore a vast open-world where you can find wild Anitons and useful resources. At first, getting by in the wilderness will not be an easy task, but as you collect and evolve more powerful Anitons, you will find a way to be invincible.
Control your Anitons in real-time combat and use the various skills you've taught them. During a fight, it is not only the strategy that plays a role but also agility and accuracy.  Fighting with wild Anitons won’t always be a fair fight, prepare to face dozens of enemies at once!

Evolve various Anitons, acquire new moves, or breed a completely new one. To do this you will need DNA points. You can obtain these by either farming this specific type of Aniton, or by fighting them in the wild. Forge your own path!
Invite multiple friends and play together. You can team up to fight Aniton Hordes on Raids, or build a new base with your friends. Use PvP duels to fight other players and test new tactics. Offline mode will of course still be an option for those who want to play solo.  Note: this feature is linked to the “Multiplayer” stretch goal.
Found your own base using resources you obtain from the wild. There, you can keep all of your Anitons and make them feel at home. You can not only place buildings but also customize the environment around you! Create a cozy place for you and your Anitons to rest after a tough fight.

Farm various monsters and resources that you will find useful throughout your journey. Each type of Aniton prefers a different kind of food. Well-fed Aniton will use his unique ability that will aid you in this aspect! Electric types can charge machines that will automate your work, fire types can heat your house, and water types can help grow your crops.
Customize your character to perfectly fit your playstyle and Aniton squad. Unlock new outfits as you progress by completing various challenges. You can also build your mansion, paint walls, and hang pictures of your friends and favorite Anitons!
Since the beginning of the development, we’ve been transparent with our goals and development process and we’ll keep on doing this until the full release. We organized a couple of contests where fans could create their own Anitons or name existing ones. If you want to shape the final look of the Anitons, join our discord here:  >>>CLICK<<<
STORY
The world of Anitons is divided into smaller areas that are habited by different kinds of monsters. On the volcanic grounds, you can find various fire type Anitons, and if you are looking for crystal types, you should visit the underground, monster-infested caves. As the player, you can freely explore this open-world continent and return to your base at any time.

There are 9 different types of Anitons. Each type has its own unique playstyle and skillset. You can choose Nature for its ability to heal or stick with Rock for its defensive skills. If on the other hand, you’re going to fight a whole bunch of enemies at once, Fire, with its area effect skills might just be perfect for you. If you’re playing with a friend, choose a combination that will increase your damage output like Water and Electric. The dual-typed Anitons only multiply already almost endless possibilities. Find your playstyle!
You start out by visiting your Uncle that lives overseas, in search of a job. You decide to help him finish his project of a lifetime - gather information about every existing Aniton. Little you know how this goal will change your life. Not only you have to build your own base, but also collect every Aniton out there. Even with the help of your friends... This might take a while.
Enough about the task, which one of these little fellas would you choose?
Anitons are the creatures living in the wild or with humans. You can create your own Anitons that will happily help you with fighting, or farming. All of your monster friends have to live somewhere, a cozy farm is perfect for them. Every Aniton loves to play, and have his favorite food that the owner must provide. With time your monsters will get experienced and will evolve into more powerful forms. During your adventure, you will meet and collect tons of them.
While going into the wild you can take up to 6 Anitons with you. They will help you travel, gather resources, and fight. If any of your monsters faint during the battle, you will have to take care of him after returning to your farm. Each Anioton can learn skills as they evolve, and the last stage can master up to 3 different abilities. While fighting the player takes control of the monster, to win he will have to use both accuracy and a tactic.
The Stegra line is the most popular three-stage evolution. You can evolve your Aniton to more powerful forms and with each evolution, it can learn new skills. Since this specific line is a mix of Rock and Nature type, while choosing a new ability for your monster you can either pick supportive Nature abilities or go with defensive Rock skills.
The Tadapas line is composed of toxic type Anitons. In the first stage Tadapas has an additional water typing that the next stage evolution is missing. This means that your Tadapas can have a water ability, but since first form ability is known from the beginning, you'll have to create a Tapadas with the exact skill that you are looking for. Using more DNA you can boost your chances to get better Anitons in creation process.
The Ottim line is different from most of the other Aniton lines. After getting enough experience to evolve, you can choose its new stage. Since Ottim's passive ability is to find random crystals, the evolution you choose will additionally influence its skill. Fishtter is a more defense-oriented evolution that will find blue crystals for you, whilst Sharker is a more offensive form that will find mostly red crystals.

To gather funding for the Anitons project we've prepared unique rewards for you to choose from. Hope you will find something just perfect for you. All gathered funds will be used for the development of the game.




During the development of our previous game, we decided that we want to become independent in terms of the production of our next title. This will provide a way to make Anitons with our community and by this, make Anitons a game of your dreams too. Success in Kickstarter will help us stay indie and provide a way to keep on developing this game. At this point in time, we cannot say if we’ll be able to develop Anitons if we won’t hit our initial $75k stretch goal, but with fans as you, this shouldn’t be our concern.
We’ve been working for almost one year to create a sharp vision of Anitons that you can see today, and we reach a point when we have to start full production. If you become a backer and trust us, this game will become yours and we’ll be excited to develop it for you. Your feedback along the way will ensure that we’re moving in the right direction. Let’s set out on this adventure together!
Meet the team behind Anitons! Our core team has been working together for the past 3 years on our previous game, Lumberhill, and since the beginning, in January we welcomed a couple of new team members. All of us are thrilled to work on this game, and right now we can’t wait to start full production. If Kickstarter will be successful, we have a plan to extend our team with talented artists to bring your game to an even higher level.
Below you can find our sketch of the Anitons project roadmap. The plan below includes working on all of the stretch goals we've prepared, so the final release date won't surprise us if we do hit those later stretch goals.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first Kickstarter campaign, but it’s not our first project. We’ve been working in a team for over three years now. Even considering Anitons is our biggest production to date, we’re prepared in terms of the technology and skills required to finish this project. At this point in time, we have been developing Anitons for almost a year.

We have used all of our experience in planning development and the budget for Anitons. Quality and deadlines are the most fundamental aspects of our work since our team is working in Agile. Quality is not only graphic that can be measured, but also gameplay and player experience. Having this in mind, we’re prepared to sacrifice minor graphical content if this can help shape Anitons into a game you will enjoy for many hours.

Since the beginning of the development, we’ve been transparent with our goals and development process and we’ll keep on doing this until the full release. As a backer, you've helped us a lot already, but there’ll be many more occasions where you can shape the final look of the Anitons. At this point in time we cannot say if we’ll be able to develop Anitons if we won’t hit our initial $75k stretch goal, but with fans as you this shouldn’t be our concern.

campaign.story:
The next chapter in the end of the world is coming in The Last Stand: Aftermath, a zombie action-adventure from veteran indie developers Con Artist Games. The game is set within the same universe as their hit Flash games, with an all-new standalone story and gameplay. It isn’t if you’re going to die… it’s what you do with the time you have left. 
 As the game opens, you’re one of a group of people struggling to survive 15 years after the end of the world. When you’re infected with the incurable zombie virus, you know the rules; you’re given some supplies and sent out from the compound to try and make a difference with the time you have left. But why is the virus suddenly becoming so deadly again after all this time? You’ll have to go far, and push past death, to find out.
Survivors await their run.
Choosing from a pool of randomly generated survivors, players set out beyond the safety of the gates to the ruins of the world beyond. They’ll select a destination to travel to and then explore it for supplies to either take for themselves or tag for retrieval by the enclave. The locations you can visit will vary from one playthrough to the next, and will contain randomised elements to make each run unique.
 The game plays in an isometric perspective in real time. If you’re spotted by the creatures roaming the streets, they’ll give chase - some faster than others - and with limited ammo and stamina, sometimes standing your ground isn’t always the best choice. There’s also the virus that’s slowly growing and mutating inside you. It’ll eventually consume you (if the zombies don’t first), but before it does, you may find that it grants you strange and dangerous benefits — at the cost of your humanity.
A survivor succumbs to a new level of infection.
In The Last Stand: Aftermath, it’s not if you’re going to die, but when. The game’s roguelite loop means that each time your character dies, you start up again as another. “Volunteers”, as they’re called in the game, begin back at the enclave. However, they’ll benefit from the progress and supplies found by their predecessors, and no journey will be the same as the last with the game's randomized maps. The journey will be long, and it won’t be easy. But with perseverance, grit, and a little bit of luck, they can overcome the odds, and learn the truth behind the renewed zombie threat. No matter what, they’ll make a difference.
The Last Stand as a series first began in 2007 with the release of the original titular web game. With each game since then, we have tried to evolve and change the series in ways that are interesting to us. Breaking out of the defense genre, The Last Stand has been an action RPG in the form of Union City and even a browser based MMO in Dead Zone. With The Last Stand: Aftermath, we’re making a roguelite that feels like a Last Stand game.
We’ve been working on The Last Stand: Aftermath for a few years now. Our goal is to provide a high-quality, single player action adventure that fans of the series will appreciate, with nods to the series’ history and existing story, but also a standalone experience that newcomers could jump right into.
With the newest entry in the series, we wanted to tell a post-post-apocalyptic zombie story, that focuses more on the people, rather than being gritty or overly violent. While Aftermath isn’t necessarily a narrative-focused game, its roguelite loop is supported by a story about making an impact no matter how hopeless things seem… and of course, a secret conspiracy.
For the music in The Last Stand: Aftermath, we're working with the amazing people at The Otherworld Agency along with multi-award winning composers Matt Mclean and Sean Tinnion. Together they're already creating an amazing soundscape that captures the  foreign nature of a world lost to nature and the infected. With your help, we are hoping to be able to expand the soundtrack even further.
Con Artist Games is currently two people from Australia; Stephen Woolcock and Chris Condon. Together, we’ve been making games for more than a decade. The Last Stand: Aftermath is our first big commercial project and our largest game to date. Chris has been working in games for 21 years, starting as a level designer, then producer and game director. Steve has been programming professionally for 16 years and has worked as a game developer for nearly a decade.

 We plan to initiate a beta within six weeks after the funding period ends. Players who choose a tier with beta access will be given access to a private Discord channel to interact with one another and the developers and will receive Steam keys to redeem and play the game for the purpose of providing feedback. We will provide several forms for players to provide direct feedback and bug reports in a simple fashion.
Please note that you will not be permitted to stream or share screenshots, footage, or other material from the game. Because the game is still in active development, it is important for us to be able to control how the game is shared and presented until it approaches its final form.
The Last Stand: Aftermath already contains a significant amount of playable content, roughly 50-60% of the overall final game. We plan to release the full game sometime next year. Between now and then, we will release regular large content updates to our beta backers. This will include additional weapons and enemies, entire new areas to explore and will culminate in the complete story and final release.

While we had initially thought to release the game in Early Access on Steam, our main goal in doing so was always to have a way to interact with our community and gather valuable feedback on their experiences with the game to better balance the gameplay.
Pivoting to a Kickstarter allows us to do that in a more controlled way, continue to develop and finish the game at a healthy and sustainable pace for our team, and have the opportunity to polish and expand the game beyond the initial funding provided by our publisher, Armor Games Studios.
We know Kickstarter gives us the opportunity to grow our community, and to work with their feedback to make our game the best it can be. 100% of investment from Kickstarter after fees and taxes will go straight to the development of The Last Stand: Aftermath!

A rare moment of peace amongst the chaos.

campaign.story:
Gather a crew, create your sail banner and start a rebellious career of a pirate who cares only about his treasures and his rum! Sail the seas, look for trouble, be the last pirate standing to retrieve all the treasures the archipelago can give! Although you may not survive every single raid, your achievements, fame and glory will!
'Out of Reach: Treasure Royale' is a spin off to the survival, base-building 'Out of Reach', but this time dozens of pirate crews face each other on the open sea, jungle islands and dark caves in a fast-paced, battle-royale style gameplay, focused on sailing, looting, bombarding and hunting treasures.
Click to add Out of Reach: Treasure Royale to your Steam Wishlist already today!
We've started to create Treasure Royale with a simple idea to blend together all the best features known from its forerunner with the emerging battle-royale style mods. After hundreds of hours spent in such games, we've already knew that the genre needs a face-lifting and we need to come up with new concepts to keep it fresh and addictive. After 2 years of full-time development, we feel ready to present you with our take on a modern first person shooter! 
Core features in a nutshell
Invite up to 3 friends, go alone or join a random team on one of the official, always-online servers
Win a battle-royale style round against 25 to 99 other pirates
Find loot, treasures and enemies on a 7sq mi (20km²) ocean with more than a dozen of islands (and more to come!)
Use fully interactive ship to sail, ram, bombard and outstrip your opponents
When eliminated - fight as a skeleton pirate against the others or wait for your crew to perform a revive ritual
When left on a wrecked ship - sacrifice a part of your HP to summon a friendly Kraken to fetch you another one!
Complete objectives and protect your treasure against other crews in the center of the Archipelago to win a round!
Collect experience, unlock unique pirate clothes, customize ships, set up your crew's banner! 

In deeper details
Players find themselves locked up in cages presumably after robbing one too many treasures. They are given one last chance to redeem by bringing back an equivalent in gold of what they've stolen to the extraction point (which is the Altar in our case). From the technical point of view, this is where we do the matchmaking and put together crews of 4 players (if they checked that option in the main menu).
When there are enough players on a server, every crew chooses a spawn point on the edge of the map where they want their ship to spawn. The hunt begins. There are 3 objectives that involve looking for treasures marked on the map. They are chosen by the server taking into account many variables to make crews sail not only similar distances, but what's most important, cross each other's way as much as possible. 
Although every pirate starts their journey with a sword and 10 cannon balls, it certainly won't be enough in close encounters. Players need to divide the round between treasure hunting, dealing with other crews and loot gathering. 
PLAY

There are currently 3 big regions consisting of several islands each with various bioms, towns, castles, wreckyards and caves. It is already enough to get lost and visit different places every round after several hours of playtime (what you could experience during the recently concluded Steam Festival), but with the help of Kickstarter community, we will be eager to add twice as many islands and 2 new bioms!
...is not the end of the world, if your crew got your back. When your HP reaches 0 for any reason, you're being moved back to the Island of the Damned, but this time the cage is open and you have a couple of revolver cartridges to fire. What you care about in such situation is to find another walking dead and eliminate it in order to get respawned somewhere near your crew.
PLAY

All that creates a whole new 'free for all' deathmatch inside a classic battle-royale gameplay and rewards players with another life regardless of teammates' effort to revive dead crew members. Speaking of reviving, while you're dead, your crew can resurrect the whole team by putting a special Idol found in treasures on the Revive Altar. It may take a while, but it's always better to have every teammate around.
When the first crew gathers all the treasures, it triggers the last objective which makes the Altar island emerge from the sea bottom and the cursed ring to shrink. Any team that puts the treasures on the altar and protects them for 5 minutes wins the round. Obviously all the other teams need to stop that in any possible way (the fatal way would work the best probably). The round also ends when there's only one crew alive for those who like to play it standard. 
Every crew starts their journey on a pirate ship equipped to destroy other ships and, in the meantime, cross oceans as fast as possible. But first things first - the crew captain is given at the very beginning an opportunity to choose a ship skin, sails colors and one of the unlocked banners. Future updates are supposed to bring also additional sail stamps just to let everyone know how experienced the crew that operates this particular ship is.
Steering wheel comes along with a hovering camera for better sailing technique through narrow passes. Sailor also needs to take into account variation of the wind, angle of turning and the number of undamaged sails when engaging a pursuit of enemy or treasures. There's also a short boost bar under Shift key available which can come in handy in certain situations.
PLAY

There are several things to do onboard to stay in game and win against other pirates. Checking horizon through windows and doors or using repairing bench to fix holes are some of them. And the most important:  
When your ship gets destroyed or your crew just leaves you behind, the old pirate ritual will be there to put you back in action. By the cost of permanent loss of 25% HP, everyone can ask a friendly kraken to fetch them a new vessel.  
Currently there are several groups of weapons ready to be found on the islands, all of them are listed below. We also stay eager to add other types of pistols and rifles to spice up the game and we hope to get feedback from players on what is most needed. 
As you may have noticed, we plan to keep it old-school with a full-screen inventory and possibility to put up to 3 add-ons on each weapon to change its stats such as sway, spread, smoke and sound, recoil, reload times. 
When it comes to protection, right now there are 3 levels of Chest armors, Vambraces and Helmets. The first ones provide an additional health bar, braces reduce overall damage before being deducted from Hp and helmets lower a headshot multiplier. 
 Another group of gear is medkits. As far as we know, a long pipe and deep bottle were always the best cure for pirates and it won't be different in Out of Reach. There's in fact another bar to represent the total alcohol gulped down that reaches 3 stages and can increase aim, run speed and HP regen.
PLAY

In Treasure Royale, every team is free to choose the most tempting ocean area to spawn on, whether it's close to islands and loot, has clear passage across the archipelago or tends to be the most pirate-crowded place on the known map. Regardless of that, everyone will have to get off the deck at some point and visit at least a few of these islands:
Skull Island with an abandoned town and dungeons hidden in caves. There you'll find a rocky shore and tons of buildings hiding their secrets. It might be explored both at the surface and underneath.
Make sure to check out pirate hideouts, some of them are accessible only by sea and may not provide any rear exit but the loot inside is exceptionally worth a glimpse.
 If you like to river cruise and try your luck with recently abandoned settlements, Canyon Islands is your way to go. You might explore variety of villages and overgrown meadows in your search for precious loot.
Tropical part of the archipelago on the other hand, feels like an exotic paradise, where you could enjoy a bottle or two like a classic pirate would do, but as much as it is a great hideout, you never know who awaits in a bush. 
Once that used to be a real melting pot of cultures, now it's known for ancient ruins of the Lost City hidden in the jungle. Maybe from the top of a steep mountain you would spot some pyramids, temples of lost civilizations...or at least some bamboo houses all of which might be worth checking out. This biom is one of the biggest on the current map and still in development.
 Desert climate might not be extremely welcoming nowadays, but in the past the old mines were really prosperous, maybe some gold was forgotten there? You might try your luck in the Kraken hunter villages, dark caves or open pit mine of the Gold Rush Islands as soon as it's ready. By the time we write it, the biom is still under balance testing and further development. 
 And what if you're not that lucky, get a headshot and end up on the Island of the Damned? Better still try to escape such a limbo full of corpses of those that did not avoid the torture tools and machines.
Current state of development
Although Out of Reach: Treasure Royale is playable and under heavy tests that could be already seen on YouTube, we want to spend a couple months more locked with it in our studio. Besides polishing that's to be made, we would like to add another big pack of features that are still not common in Battle Royale genre. In order to do so, we've decided to come on Kickstarter and ask for your support that could buy us more time with artists and programmers to make the game we all want to play. 
Very Early Bird: You get your Steam-key with an invitation for a server-warming party! Come in wearing a special pirate's hat available only for Very Early Birds. Additionally you get access to our Discord channel to ask questions, share your ideas and feedback. We also put your name in game credits.
Old Sea Dog: You get your Steam-key with an invitation for a server-warming party and a special backer's badge in your in-game character's profile. Additionally you get access to our Discord channel to ask questions, share your ideas and feedback. We also put your name in game credits.
Adventures Pack: Clearly you love adventure, so here you get the Old Sea Dog perk and additionally we give you the access to the forerunner: 'Out of Reach' - the survival game.
Very Early Seawolf: Get the limited Seawolf perk with everything that the Old Sea Dog gives and an additional Steamkey for your pirate friend!
The Unique Pirate: You get the  Old Sea Dog perk and you can send us your design of the Sail Banner in any form and we will bring it to the game. The custom banners will be available for all players to unlock.
Not-a-lone-seawolf: You'd rather go around with a bunch of folks, so here you get the Old Sea Dog perk with 4 Steam-keys instead of 1!
The Unique Crew: You get the Not-a-lone-seawolf perk and you can send us your design of the Sail Banner in any form and we will bring it to the game. The custom banners will be available for all players to unlock.
Boatbuilder: You get The Unique Crew perk and more! Send us your concept of the Ship textures (e.g. flooring, masts, hull, doors, etc.) in any form and we will implement them in the game –  share the goodness with all players.
Fashionista Pirate: You get the Not-a-lone-seawolf perk and you can send us your texture concept in any form to be applied to the in-game character including hat, shirt, coat, pants, boots and skin. You make a real impact, as every pirate will be able to unlock your design!
The Distiller: You get the Adventures Pack perk with 4 Steam-keys instead of 1 – for both 'Out of Reach' games! Share your bottle concept and its name with us and we will make sure that the rum's in-game supply will be exactly yours, ready to be found and used by every player!
The Castaway: You get the Adventures Pack perk with 4 Steam-keys instead of 1 – for both 'Out of Reach' games! Send us your model (3D or 2D) of anything that could exist in XVIII century or before (starting from a bottle in the ocean, sword for every player to use up to buildings), add a message for the rest of the players to it and we will include it in the game!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With a constant maintenance of the first Out of Reach since 2015, we feel like being ready to face all the challenges a multiplayer game and official, always on-line servers can bring. However, as a small studio, we strongly need a community of players around the game, that will tell us what to add in the next patches and spread a good word to the world about OoR. Without a solid number of concurrent players, there can not be a solid battle-royale game, that's why we would like to invite all of you to participate in the campaign already today and meet on one of the servers when the premiere comes!

Demon Knights is a revolutionary dark Action Role-Playing Game with deep traditional 2D Fighting-Game mechanics within a beautiful dark gothic world of Ankhoron.
Master ancient powers and loot enchanted items to upgrade your hero, play with friends and defeat demonic monsters who stand in your way.
A brand new rich dark world focused on epic combat, exploration, trading and combat in 3rd person over-the-shoulder
Action RPG Story mode– Offline or Online(Single or Multiplayer co-op play)
Unique Hero Characters with swappable armor, upgradable weapons, randomized loot drops, crafting, and customizeable magic skill system
Unique Monster Characters with unique monster skills and progression
Fighting Game arena for PVP and in-game bounty hunters modes
No Subscriptions
No Pay to Win
Buy a full copy of game for ~$30 USD ($240 hkd) a 25% discount from our target retail price at launch!
Darkness is sweeping the land of Ankhoron. The small mining town of Ashridge is at the center of the disturbances. The main bridge to town is destroyed and the villagers are now trapped in the town being overrun by monsters. Leaders calls for any who can help. Adventurers step up as they now must all fight to survive. 
 Ankhoron is a new original world full of magic and heroes of immense power.
The northern city of Ashridge was once prosperous because of its thriving farms and rich mines.  But all things golden eventually tarnish. A curse unleashed by necromantic cultists from the North shook the land with a series of violent earthquakes.The poisonous ash released by the tremors killed off the once abundant crops in the surrounding valley, and crumbled the tunnels within the mines. The once-great crumbled to dust as the townspeople fled the dying city and were replaced by mutant monsters and undead victims of wars foughtlong ago. But hope remains that Ashridge may one day be restored to its former glory by a remedy that scholars say may be found in the ancient shrines buried deep below the city.
"I spent many an hour enjoying the pleasures that Ashridge once had to offer. But the dark magics its insubordinate mages unleashed shattered what was once a jewel of our homeland, leaving behind a treacherous den of despair in its place. I pity those who must set foot into its lifeless corridors and reside within its decrepit hovels, forever existing in a state of fear and unrest." From the notes of an unknown explorer.
Ashridge is a map built vertically deep into dungeons and up into mines above. But exploration is not always easy as there are many shortcuts, hidden keys, hidden passages, and monsters that block your way. 
Ankhoron - an expansive world of many cultures with a geography covering 20+ cities and 2 continents.
Black Keep
The world of Ankhoron is the cradle of humanity. It is home to the cities of the Seven Empires that were formed around the sacred magics of the dragons who once ruled the world. The texture of Ankhoron’s great continents is as varied as the people who live upon its land, from its towering mountain ranges to its vast and violent seas.
"I have walked this land of Ankhoron from coast to coast, and I have experienced many of its highest highs and lowest lows. Yet for all of this ancient continent’s vibrant beauty and diverse life, there is much pernicious evil hidden within its depths. Ensure your eyes stay as open as your heart when you traverse its terrain."  Telvir of the Drakien Monks
The world of Ankhoron with many undiscovered lands
- Deep customizable Fighting Game combat in an ARPG - We plan to add the depth of  top Fighting-Game Combat to ARPGs by building combat to allow customizeable combos, counters, parries, and magic effects all built on existing Fighting Game fundamentals. 
- Original AAA Art and Artists - Our studio and game idea has been able to attract AAA talent both full time and part-time to create AAA quality art for our game. This include concept artists, 3d modelers, 3d animators, and 3d environmental artists. 
- Original Gameplay with unique players - Play through the game as a Knight or one of the Demon monsters in the game. Demon monsters have unique access to monster skillset and a scalable AI with personality and aggressiveness that scales up at later difficulties!
- Looting systems inspired by the best ARPG’s- Loot is a big part of ARPGs and yet most good ARPG looting mechanics such as:  –Random drops, Crafting/customization, and set items bonuses.
- Building Difficult-but-Fair Game- Enemies, bosses, and challenges will be built to always give players a chance. Those with high skill can attempt the game without completing the loot quests to improve gear and lower skill players can still expect to complete the game with just basic attacks by collecting lots of loot to improve equipment. 
- ESports and Replayability - Player vs Player will be balanced by scaling all damage to   base levels (normalizing to 100%) which means you will always fighting heroes on a balanced playing field suitable for Esports or Co-op gameplay. Our late game will also give all enemies improved AI (Artificial Intelligence) access to full range of combos, abilities, randomized enhancements, and strategies that will challenge the best players.
- Combat and Skill Trees - Choose your iconic hero, your weapon preference, and school of magics. Together you can access the deep and customizeable skill-trees for different types of combat including: quick melee, slow melee, ranged projectile, ranged AOE, Healing support-skill, charging/dashing, complex setup/mix-ups, and many others to come later. We expect to add additional hero types, weapon types, and magic schools each year and each season after launch. Feedback from the community will help us decide which skills and abilities are most desired and need to most help.
- Lore and living cities - Our cities are designed to evolve as your character grows, with the stories and capabilities of NPCs evolving as you help them and the empty houses filling in as NPCs are saved and rejoin the city. Each NPC is already created with a backstory and relationships that will be exposed as the game and story evolves.
- Expansion Locations - Our world is built with 20+ cities and many vertical hidden dungeons, hideouts, secrets, bosses, enemies, and NPCs in each city. Eventually we plan to allow players to visit each town where the Heroes/NPCs came from to learn their story and develop their skills. We believe planning for the depth of a large evolving world helps bring the world of Ankhoron and its people to life.
- Multiplayer and Networking  - Our games is built from the ground up to incorporate 16+ player networking. Initially we are optimizing for 2 person co-op or 2 person PVP but we have planned to expand this into larger 5 person group and 16+ people group PVP in the future. Our Networking is already working now.

Once known as the Great Sewers of Ashridge, they were once viewed as an engineering marvel by the people that it served. They were originally built to carry life-giving water to every corner of the city and the mountain mines. But the massive tunnels fell into disarray when the city was abandoned, and only a select fewew remaining now know how to navigate their byzantine layout. To most, the sewers only continue to exist as a home for the vicious rat‐men and other murderous creatures who plague Ashridge’s remaining citizenry. Even so, brave adventurers who choose to explore the perilous labyrinth might still find great treasure within its nooks and crannies.

The Deep Mines rivalled the Great Sewers of Ashridge as one of the engineering marvels of its day. Its maze of tunnels burrows deep into the heart of the mountain range that surrounds the Ashridge Valley and contains within it a wealth of precious jewels and ores that would make kings blush. But a series of powerful earthquakes that erupted when the rogue mages cast their dark spells collapsed many of the subterranean tunnels. Adventurers who wish to brave what remains of the Mountain Mines to search for lost treasures would do best to avoid the horrible creatures lurking in its depths.

Watch for them the ceilings, be careful when walking past holes, and listen for the clacking sounds when they come... Burn them all before it is too late!

Dark magic mutated the sewer rats that roam the remnants of the Great Sewers into wily and viciously territorial rat-men who will fight to the death to defend their underground home from intruders. Staffing - We have been lucky in attracting AAA talent but we are competing with AAA studios for staff and some staff may get a offer at a larger studio which we cannot match.
Technical - As a small studio we are limited in our resources and depend on our staff and our network of friends to help us past any technical issues. So far this has not been a large problem but most of our delays come from discovery of bugs that need to be solved.
Marketing and Competition - As a small studio we have limited reach in promoting our game globally and depend highly on our community of fans and influencers to help promote our game. campaign.story:
PLAY

A third-person open world survival horror action RPG set in a universe you've never experienced before. Play as one of the Forsaken, the last frontier of humanity against the growing horrors of the Omnistructure. As you find yourself stranded in a faraway outpost, you must adapt in order to survive. The world won't wait for you though, you must venture into the unknown - your faith will decide your fate.
Our estimated release date would be:
Q4 2019 for Early Access
Q1-Q2 2020 for Full Release
Subsequent updates with content, quality of life improvements, and potential bugfixes. 
Platforms: PC (PS4 and Xbox are on our urgent roadmap, but won't be at the same time as the PC release, when we can cover the financial and logistical expenses more comfortably.)
We were initially going to include a console release as a stretch goal, but we felt that was unfair towards console gamers who would love to play the game. So we're going to be clear here:
Bleak Faith: Forsaken is going to release on PS4 and Xbox the moment we have the resources to do so - it's at the top of our priorities with bug fixes - we cannot give an accurate estimate at this moment of when that would be but a few months after a PC release could possibly be the date! However, it's not in our hands and a lot of steps have to be made before we get there and before we get approved. Bare in mind it's a crucial part of the development of this game for us so until it happens we're not quitting :)
We'll keep you updated on this as we develop and as the console release develops. We are however already close to finalizing controller input support! 
Feel the burden of surviving in one of the last remaining outposts of the Forsaken, a legion of hunters condemned to protect the last vestige of humanity. The nature of your purpose however is shrouded in mystery, and as you delve deeper into the manifold halls of the Omnistructure, you will come to find the true meaning of alienation, isolation, and dread. A cross between cyberpunk, and dark fantasy - Bleak Faith will offer a story and experience that will be a breath of fresh air for all gamers looking for a something new. The world is full of lore, and every aspect of it is crafted with utmost passion and a dedication to art. As a baseline there is an estimated 30+ hours of content, a deep class system, and a procedural AI system that ensures that no playthrough is ever the same.
The architecture of the world, the Omnistructure, is a huge aspect of the game. Meticulously designed and crafted, Bleak Faith aims to provide an emergent narrative method coupled with more structured traditional moments. The world of Bleak Faith is  labyrinthine, tapping into an innate curious instinct we all have when faced with many defined branching choices - we focus on creating a strong sense of curiosity about the path not taken, by offering unique and compelling content in every area of the world - having said that the world employs both vast open areas, and more linear openness in Metroidvania fashion. The aim is to evoke that same feeling of wonder and excitement that you felt the first time you played a game, the first time you experienced 3D graphics, the first time you experienced something that felt formative and not habitual. Open world in Bleak Faith is a crucial aspect to showing you the reality of the Forsaken. In this world there are few havens for the Forsaken, and these are generally outposts which serve as bases (of various complexities and utility) to recover from journeys and prepare for more - however, nowhere is truly safe!
Expect tight and meticulously crafted and expanded combat that brings tempo and action to this world in amazing quality and detail. We're not shying away from a challenge, and so we're going all in. Despite being a small team, we couldn't accept a simple mundane combat system; we are making it fleshed out, and very robust. The combat communicates the danger in adrenaline-pumping fashion. Fast, responsive, and unforgiving - you will earn and feel every victory, nothing comes easy. Approach combat in your own way however - choose stealth over face-to-face combat, choose ranged over melee, choose Technomancy over more traditional combat styles. The system allows you to express yourself through combat, or through avoiding it - and that's further supported through a class system as well. 
How better to experience the unyielding uncertainty of the Omnistructure than through a simulated ecosystem of factions and AI groups. Inhabitants of the Omnistructure will compete among themselves, grow and expand, change and adapt - the food chain in the ecosystem will, as a result, mold to every playthrough (e.g. an apex predator from your last playthrough might have already died out in this playthrough and you never fight it again). It's a constant race against time as enemies will try and outgrow and outsmart not only you, but other competition. Hunt, scavenge, and grow to stay on top of the food chain. Never experience an area the same way as the procedural nature of the ecosystem will ensure that you can never let your guard down. Having said that, there are still linear areas of the game, especially those that cover main plot points - to ensure a direction and purpose for the player. The ecosystem makes every moment of gameplay interesting and engaging - even on multiple playthroughs.
Fight against the odds, and stay alive despite the Omnistructure's evergrowing threat. Craft, scavenge, hunt, and find ways to excel. Pick a class, upgrade stats, augment your character, create equipment and stay healthy. Resist the Puppet Plague, and the many afflictions present in the world which can change the outcome of your journey entirely. campaign.story:
It all started back in 2008 when the founders of EvolveHQ wanted to make it easier to connect, coordinate, and play PC games over the web. To make that happen, they built a virtual private network (VPN) client directly into their product. That VPN functionality was the heart that beat in a platform that eventually grew to 4.5M registered members and hosted tens of millions of multiplayer game sessions before it merged with another platform in 2018. 
However, the new platform chose to leave the VPN functionality behind... Now, the founders of EvolveHQ want to bring VPN-enabled gaming back in a new, more powerful package all its own. A new product that delights in its power and simplicity – a product we call Bowstring.
TL;DR
Setting up virtual local area network (VLAN) parties over the web sucks. Bowstring makes it awesome.
How It Works
Bowstring is NOT a traditional VPN service. Its primary use is NOT to tunnel across the web to anonymize and/or obfuscate your internet traffic patterns. 
Bowstring is designed from the ground up to create peer-to-peer virtual networks that look and function as though they exist on a common LAN, but in actuality are remote web connections.
Peer-to-Peer = Power-to-the-People
Essentially, anything you can do on a LAN you can do over the internet with Bowstring: 
Play games. 
Share directories and files. 
Access and stream media libraries.
Share printers, and much much more.
Bowstring is optimized for multiplayer LAN-gaming. 
Bowstring is built on the same world class VPN technology that supported EvolveHQ – the social network and collaboration toolset for gamers.
Yet we've designed Bowstring to be even more powerful and scaleable than its predecessor, thanks in part to an updated codebase, reduced application overhead, and true peer-to-peer connectivity and throughput. In the past, the EvolveHQ platform itself was a bottleneck to LAN play. With Bowstring, its sole purpose is stable, secure, localized connectivity. There's nothing to get in the way.
Most virtual LAN products require users to know a bunch of technical mumbo jumbo network things like IP addresses, proxy settings, and "NAT traversal". Not Bowstring.
Bowstring makes it easy. Just host or join a virtual network via a simple link. The host automatically becomes a network controller and Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server, issuing addresses to connected clients, or guests, over a stable, encrypted connection. Virtual networks can be open or password-protected and stay connected as long as the host maintains the session.
Bowstring establishes efficient, secure peer-to-peer PC connections as part of an ad-hoc, shared network. Peer-to-peer can be particularly helpful in regions where international internet connectivity carries additional costs or where internet traffic is closely monitored. That's because Bowstring isn't dependent on Content Delivery Networks (CDNs) to route traffic. Instead, the host's location is the only network node that matters, and when guests connect to a node within the same region, they get the fastest, most efficient, and cheapest connectivity possible.
Rewards
This Kickstarter campaign will be the ONLY time we ask the universe whether or not this product should exist. If we reach our goal, we will bring it to market *as soon as possible*. If not, then we'll save everyone a lot of time and heartache.
*ANY* amount is extremely appreciated. You are voting with your money, which is incredibly humbling. We want to thank you in advance for whatever level you choose to support Bowstring. If you're not old enough or don't have funds to support us at this time, now is a perfect time to put Bowstring on your Holiday wish list.
The $25 support tiers and higher offer discounted licensing for the eventual product, plus some very, very sexy incentives.

THIS GAME IS 100% FINISHED and works on the real NES console! We are running this Kickstarter campaign in order to raise funds for cartridge, box and manual production.
Micro Mages is a new platform game for the NES, play solo or with up to 4 players simultaneously. Fight to get the best score or cooperate to overcome challenging sections.
NES version
All officially released console versions and regions are supported: NTSC NES, PAL NES, Famicom with a 72-to-60-pin cartridge adapter (not included).
High-quality clones such as the retroUSB AVS and Analogue Nt mini are also supported. Furthermore, our testers confirmed the game works on the RetroN 5.
Digital version
Alternatively, we offer a ROM version. This allows you to play the game on your PC and many other platforms through the use of an emulator. 
Alongside the ROM download, we will provide easy-to-understand instructions on how to set up an emulator and play Micro Mages on a Windows PC.
Enter the Demon Fortress. Built to torture pesky adventurers, this place is home to great treasure and ghastly creatures alike. But don't worry, you can count on allies like Fairies and Magical Seagulls to come to your help!
Micro Mages is an homage to NES-era platformers. Being a homebrew NES game itself, it was made completely from scratch. We carefully distilled the spirit of the best games in the system's library, all the while drawing inspiration from the modern and putting our own spin on things, creating an experience like no other on the NES.
© Grzegorz Karkoszka. Pictures from Gamefest at gamesweekberlin 2018.
While many homebrew games and later commercial NES releases can be upwards of 512 Kilobytes in size, we challenged ourselves to make the best game we could given the harsh limitations that the very first NES titles (e.g., Super Mario Bros.) had to deal with. That is, the whole game fits into 40 Kilobytes. Micro Mages could have been an NES launch title!
And yet, fun was our number one priority, the classics were our benchmark. Half of the game's development time was spent on optimization and polish. Fluid gameplay, tight controls and a carefully balanced challenge were our dedication.
Multiplayer mode
That's right, Micro Mages supports up to 4 simultaneous players. We made sure the game plays perfectly well in single player mode, but for that extra bit of fun, do invite friends and family!
Players of all skill levels can take part in the action. Play carefully and cooperate to overcome difficult sections OR take risks, shove your friends into lava and snatch the high score!
As long as at least one player is alive, you won't lose a life. Dead players turn into ghosts and have the ability to help their comrades by freezing enemies. They can also destroy crates and treasure chests in the hope of finding a Fairy or Magic Seagull Feather that will bring them back to life.
Micro Mages is full of surprises
Up to 4 simultaneous players
8 worlds spanning a total of 26 levels (normal + hard mode)
Dangerous traps, monsters and bosses
Secrets!
Password function
40 Kilobytes, fully optimized

We are a two-man team from Berlin, dedicated to bringing new games to old hardware!
Julius created Morphcat Games in 2011 when he released the NES demo Super Bat Puncher. He made other games during game jams and also composes music on his free time. On Micro Mages, he did the programming, created tools for data optimization as well as music and sound effects.
Nicolas joined Julius during the Ludum Dare 32 game jam and together they created a short NES game named Banana Nana. On Micro Mages, he made the graphics and levels as well as box and manual illustrations.

Moglins were born in the world of video games… but with your help they can escape into the real world.

Meet the Moglins
Put a Moglin on your desk to cheer you on. They’ll keep you company while writing, drawing, coding, and gaming. Moglins love to watch your favorite shows with you...even when no one else will. You can keep the joy for yourself, or give a Moglin to someone you love.
Moglins are born under a special moon and each has a unique power. They say Twilly has the power to heal, but really he is so encouraging that you really heal yourself.
Moglins are as unique as the heroes they adventure with. Be careful, Zorbak may try to reanimate your lunch with his necromancy magic.
Twig is adorable, immortal, and a 'lil bit crazy in the most adorable way.
Formerly the assistant to the greatest dungeon designer in the world, Mort loves hanging out with creative people-- writers, artists, musicians, and gamers.
Shhh, Memet's not really a Moglin... she's really a Baku that eats bad dreams. She will be your loyal guardian..
Rumor has it that Quibble's backpack full of "used rare items that have not been created yet" thanks to his relationship with a slightly corrupt time travel fairy. We looked-- and all we saw was stuffing.
Avast ye' lilly livered land lubber... if ye be look'n for an able 1st mate, Scurvy will join yer crew. Is it ironic that he is orange-- considering his name?
Moglins come in all alignments... good, evil, chaotic, and cupcake.
Scourge's secret is given away by his glowing blue eyes. He's the most adorable member of the Undead Legion.
Zilla loves cosplay, anime, imported snacks, and dreams of making a friend to run a YouTube channel with.
Rez is a brave and heroic paladin... the goodest type of good! But his puns are real bad.
Legend says the mighty dricken is half-dragon... half-chicken. "Bwak-Bwak-Raaawr!"
Every Moglin includes a code for in-game pets of itself!

Naturally, your custom items must follow the family friendly guidelines and fit suitably in immersive game play. Moglin Care Instructions
Never get them wet. 
Never catch them on fire. 
Never freeze them. 
Never electrocute them. 
Depending on Moglin-- hug, cuddle, snarl, or stare menacingly daily. 
Never put the ones with necromancy skills near a graveyard. 
Keep Shadow Moglins away from the sunlight... and black holes. 
Put them somewhere you can see them. 
Do not inject an AI controlled metal skeleton into them for autonomy. 
OK, maybe you can do that last one. Send us video. 
...and never, ever, no matter what, never launch them into outer space as part of a publicity stunt. Unless it is a specifically designated space moglin.

Congratulations... you did it! As a surprise thank you, all of your AdventureQuest Worlds in-game pet rewards will now be Battle Pets! You also unlocked a bonus exclusive pet. The current idea for the Exclusive Kickstarter in-game pet is a game Moglin named "Punster". Feel free to send us your name suggestions! You also unlocked the live puppet show. Check out the highlight reel using link below. The code included with each of your Moglins will now unlock in-game pets in 4 video games! Additional funding will unlock more bonus perks.

Break Down
Transparent as that one moglin who learned an invisibility spell.
10% of the total funding will go towards Kickstarter fees that all project creators must pay when using Kickstarter as a medium to receive backing from the public.
20% of the total funding goes towards the creation of in-game rewards. This includes designing, developing, animating and programming the in-game items.
54% of the total funding goes towards the actual manufacturing of the physical Moglin plushies.
15% of the total funding goes towards the shipping of the plushies from the Manufacturer's facility overseas to our lab.
1% goes towards coffee because it is a great motivator for folks who put several hours into the inner workings of this project day in and day out!
Time Line
Kickstarter! Runs Tuesday August 14th until September 13th, 2018
14 Days for funds to clear 
3 Months of magically spawning Moglins at the tower of magic 
Moglins take a 1 month boat ride here to Florida, USA

FAQ
I pledged... but there is no charge. Why?
Kickstarter only charges when the campaign ends AND it is fully funded.
What if I change my address between now and the ship date?
We will allow address changes up to two weeks before we ship. Do not worry, we will send you reminders through kickstarter.
I pledged for Just The Codes... when will they be sent?
To be fair to all backers, we will distribute the codes at the same time we physically ship the Moglins. ETA December 2018/January 2019.
My Moglin is talking to me... should I be concerned?
No. It's OK. You’re probably just a fun and creative person. O_O *gulps*
Story Time! Moglin Lore
Twilly was the very first Moglin created. Artix drew him in bed in 2001 while watching DragonBall Z on the cartoon network. Twilly was originally bean shaped with hair like one of those troll pen thingies from the '80s. He also had tennis shoes. Supposedly because he was a time traveler and liked going to the mall. He was put into the original AdventureQuest game, but redrawn a few times... red, with a football shaped head and giant feet. It was not until the amazing artist Oishii came along that the version of Twilly that we all know and love was drawn. She has brought him to life across our games. She also drew the ebil Zorbak and the adorable Twig. Loved by players, Moglins have become the mascots of our games. They have special place in our hearts... now we will bring them into the real world for both us and the next generation.
Thank you

"Life is Hard“ will be an open world multiplayer life simulation with focus on player interaction. In the beginning of your journey you will start as a regular Citizen. As you progress in life, you will get opportunities to take on different roles – you may start a carrier as a Police officer or become the leader of a criminal organization. In "Life is Hard“, the goal is to get money and reputation. You can achieve this by either being a regular citizen who starts his own small business or by becoming a well known criminal. It will be possible to rent apartments, basements for your crew and buy vehicles aswell.
  You will have options to create your own, unique character who can wear different kind of clothes. You will start the game with your own little apartment but as you proceed and gain money and reputation, you will have the option to fully customize it. You can also buy houses where you can either live on your own or share with your friends. Housing plays a huge role in "Life is Hard". It is not only your spawn point, but it also your main storage. Here, you will find purchased clothes, your items and your car.
example for a player apartment
  Everything you do will influence your reputation. By helping other players, you can gain reputation which allows you to take on new tasks and jobs. In contrast, robbing people damages your image, but opens new ways for you to pursue illegal activities such as creating drugs or robbing a bank.
  an open world that gives you the option to visit various places. Go shopping at the mall, buy drugs in the slums of the suburban area or take a break from the busy city life, in the Country side where you can relax by hunting in the woods. It is up to you how your live your life – there are no limits.
asset concept of a neighbourhood
  Depending on which path you chose, you can complete criminal or legal missions to gain respect and progress in your job. Remember that it will always affect your reputation. There will also be missions which involve other players. If you want to do a robbery, the police officer will be notified and try to stop you.
  If you go criminal or do a legally business is in your hands, of course your character not only will have the reputation of the way you choose. There are some optical differences aswell. You can fully customize your clothes. you unlock legally/illegaly progress clothes while you playing.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our first game: Many times new teams will be too ambitious on their first try, go above and beyond what they can deliver. I want to make sure everyone knows the core gameplay experience has been locked down. If you have any doubts about the game's quality, it's playable as of right now. Go to www.fatalvelocity.com and download the pre-alpha build right now. Message me and if I'm not at work, I'll be more than happy to show you the game! 

Team Size & Development Speed: We were a 2 person team working part time on Fatal Velocity until July when we had an artist join the team. If the game is funded awesome! We can focus full time and pick up the pace getting more content out sooner. If the Kickstarter campaign exceeds expectations we can get more hands on deck really help push the developement speed and quality! 

Content Creep: A lot of teams suffer from not being able to axe their ideas if they don't work - closing the door for good on their babies. We approach game development with a chainsaw, if the idea works - AWESOME, if it doesn't, chop it down to see if it can fit and if it still doesn't, burn it. Not facing up to the limitations, hard deadlines can end up being very costly and will only bring more problems towards development.

Multiplayer Server Browser: We've only dabbled into creating server browsers, so there's no denying this will definitely take time. We'll ask those who do know and move forward on this. Don't worry though, we have quick connect working so you can still play with friends and others right now! 

Being Unknown: Anonymity is the sweet, bitter kiss of death for any new game developer/team. Nothing sucks more than working your dream project, only to end up flying under the radar and all the work and the potential going to waste. We've been reaching out to YouTubers, Twitch streamers, curators, journalists to get their feedback on the game and all throughout Fatal Velocity's existence we'll keep contacting others to help get as much attention on it as possible for as long as possible. 

New Game Concept Means Experimentation: The design of Fatal Velocity is quite unique, especially when it comes to weapons, abilities and level designing. It's been a very meticulous design process, but ultimately answering the question when anything new is added, "is this fun and does this have purpose?" There's no path to follow for FV so a lot of time has been spent throwing ideas at the wall and seeing what stuck. For example, a new game mode like Spider-Man + Quidditch sounds like it would be a cool idea, but would it be fun? Time would be invested in finding out! 

Keeping the community up to date: If you have any doubts on the updates, we make a development vlog about Fatal Velocity's progress roughly every 2 weeks. Jaime also does what he calls a "Fatal Velocity Rambles" where he talks about FV as a whole, ideas and all! We're very proud of our work, so we post on Instagram, Facebook and YouTube often! 

Funding Amount: The more monies we get the more contracts can be sent out and to get high quality unique assets made! Not depending on Turbosquid, CGTrader or the Unreal Marketplace for assets would be incredible! Don't get me wrong, those sites still have purpose even with a large budget (modify existing assets) but to have the budget to truly create a world we can create together?! That would be AWESOME! Will we have enough funds - that's up to you and help getting the word out!

updates.update_userinfo: We're Live At C4 All Weekend Long
updates.update_content:
I will be straight the point. I've waiting to get to an event to show Fatal Velocity off for since the first week of development. To be at an event where hundreds, no... thousands of people can see the game is incredibly awesome. I love getting their honest opinions of the game face to face, seeing the excitement or enthusiasm they had on their faces as they played the game. The best part of it all though? The problems that I thought were problems, were of no concern to the playtester.
We spent about the first hour dusting ourselves off, getting into the groove of approaching people cold, but after a while - it simply came naturally. Getting people excited to be Spider-Man with Goku powers in a Smash Bros Environment, discovering pickups that help amp up their capabilities gave us the confidence to really seek out as many people as possible. In fact, we had to ask a few people who had been playing for quite some time to come back because we needed to free up a computer to get new players in, there was a small line forming!

Of course, we can't see into the future and know if everything goes well.

campaign.story:
Solace Crafting is aiming to become a leader in both crafting and building games. I believe that both crafting and building are only fun with reasons to engage in and improve them. They need purpose and sustainability.
     That's exactly where the term "Solace Crafting" comes from. Solaces are a player crafted facility that act as a beacon for instant travel in a boundless multiverse. When a Solace is placed or upgraded, it must be defended for several minutes as evil spawns to try and stop it. As difficulty is based on our distance from the start, placing Solaces deeper into the wild becomes increasingly challenging, asking players to unlock and upgrade new traps, gather stronger resources, craft better equipment, befriend stronger allies, and increase their combat abilities.
     I love building and crafting games like Minecraft, Terraria, and 7 Days to Die. Another part of me loves fantasy role-playing games like Everquest and Dungeon & Dragons Online. In 30 years of gaming I never found a game that bridged those two genres together in the way I always imagined. Building and crafting were always just tossed in like a mini-game, letting players dabble in it if they wanted to. I was done waiting for someone to design something better.
     This is me, following my dream, taking development into my own hands. I spent five years making sure I knew what I wanted to do and how to do it. Now that my goal is in sight, this campaign will allow me to focus full-time long enough to finish the final stages of early access.
Special Features
(almost all features below are already in-game and working)
     View the world around you over 48 kilometers(35 miles) in all six directions. Our distance engine renders not only the landscape but encounters like floating islands, pyramids in the desert, NPC towns, and more. This lets you choose what content to engage in, with global events like meteor showers now possible on a massive scale.
       The further we travel from the start, in any direction, the higher the level of monster, encounter, and quests we will encounter. This lets us control when and where we move to the next level, with no strict limitations. Higher level also does not mean "end-game" grind, only difficulty increases, not time spent, or experience required to level. Resources, loot, quests, everything evolves as you push deeper.
       Summon a new Solace almost anywhere in the multiverse for instant travel back and forth from your castle in the mountains to your forge deep underground removing the need to walk back and forth.
Build traps and hire defenders to help protect against several waves of monsters that will try to interrupt summoning and upgrading
Store unlimited resources on an omniversal network, accessible within range of any Solace
Connect to parallel dimensions and elemental planes
Upgrade any Solace's range, power, visibility, aura, and more
Help strengthen and defend NPC Town Solaces for rewards
     Our unique crafting system offers simple yet complete customization of all equipment and enchantment recipes. Swords, bows, gauntlets, any type of equipment can be easily customized to fit your level and class, never forced to use what's "best," or only what's available.
Easily customize equipment color, set enchants, rarity and more. No preset recipes.
No timers, no mini-games, no sub-components, and no cross dependency.
Improve entire professions and sub-categories with unlocks and upgrades.
All recipes can be used by all levels.
(Video update on crafting from July 2017)
       Spend your skill points on as many skill trees as you like, mixing sword and sorcery, to create a truly unique character. We're aiming for variety and fun instead of strictly balanced presets.
Skill trees branch and evolve unlocking rewards, recipes, passives, and new skills depending on where you spend your points.
Add support abilities to your skills granting fire damage, a chance to stun, and more, even across different class trees, making for thousands of possible combinations.
       Shape and color your hero to match your idea of "heroic". Plump, skinny, tall, and short, we want players to play who they want. Mix ears, fangs, tails, and more with no "racial" restrictions.
       Our adaptive building interface allows easy and precise building upwards and outwards without the need to crawl and jump. We want to have fun, rather than make players spend hours to get anything done.
Neatly organized interface designed to grow with new content.
Build freely with no physics based limitations, no falling apart.
Buildings do not decay or disappear over time.
Use the keyboard to move and build massive structures in no time.
(Video update on player building from June 2017)
       Harvesting often takes up a fair amount of player time in crafting games. I'm working hard to make the experience more entertaining with harvesting specific skills and abilities to help extract, explode, and seek out resources. Leveling up your harvesting professions also gives you the opportunity to unlock harvesting specific enchants and recipes to personalize your tools with.
      Encounters are the main source of experience, recipes, and rare resources. They can be as small as a pair of elementals guarding a rift tear, to an extended siege on an NPC town that you've helped construct and must now defend against evil.
    Encounter quests are built to support crafting and building just as much as exploration and adventure. Imagine coming across a wizard at level 16 who says he needs a new staff, or a town ravaged by wolves that is in desperate need of a new fence. Repairing the fence can lead to setting up further defenses, which can then lead to a timed defense campaign, earning you a new enchant recipe, a permanent fast-travel location, and a new type of guardian for your own defenses.
NPC towns are aware of and can direct players to encounters up to 4km(2.5mi) away.
Help towns evolve gaining access to vendors, fast-travel, defenders, recipes, and more.
       My name is Kyle Postlewait. Seattle born geek and mountaineer, I found my ambition living in Japan over the past eight years. I love to create things both digital and physical, whether I'm cooking, woodworking, or landscaping.
     Currently, I work at an aluminum and zinc foundry designing machines for the automobile industry. My work requires very strict data control and management skills. I have learned a lot working in an ISO certified environment, both as a team member and as a leader, and have brought many of these skills with me into game development.
     On my journey thus far I've run into thousands of people just like me looking for a chance to create music, models, animations, and more. I work with some of them already, and hope to work with many more.
     After feeling let down by several big titles, and down right swindled by several others, I decided to create my own studio and work hard to do and be better. Thus, Big Kitty Games was founded atop five major guidelines:
To be honest: No pay-to-win. No squandering funds (funds are not profit!). No paid DLC. No racism. No sexism. No bigotry. Additions pending.
To promote good sportsmanship wherever possible.
To seek the middle ground of rated content. No excessive gore, excessive violence, or unnecessary sexual content.
To prioritize problematic content. Bug fixes and anti-cheat countermeasures should always take top priority.
To be community driven. We will include our community in design decisions and promote content submission as much as possible.
     As a husband and owner of four cats I need a minimal source of income to buy cat toys and kitty litter. With Kickstarter I'm reaching out for that minimal survival quotient, backed up by my savings, so that I can switch to full-time game development instead of a couple hours of free-time after work.
     Kickstarter also brings with it a great platform to connect directly with backers, engage in open discussions, and form a lasting community.
How can one person achieve this?
     Rest assured I am not doing this alone. I am the only active developer yes, but I work hand in hand with a variety of developers to help improve their tools for terrain, weather, animations and more. These in turn improve the visual quality and functionality of Solace Crafting.
     I am not seeking to create AAA graphics, favoring instead replayability and growth potential. The pivotal role that Solaces play in player progression through the game world brings in tons of potential for growth. Building and upgrading Solaces in increasingly difficult areas rewards quick access to higher level resources, quests, and more, creating clear and immediate benefits to improving your building and crafting skills.
     The next big step after our more immediate goals of quests, skills, and defenses are realized is the introduction of The Elemental Planes.
     With crafting and building present as core features of the game, having dimensions rich in rare resources such as stone, wood, and metal, makes for wonderfully contrasting landscapes. The current world is very Earth-like with trees and grass, mountains and lakes, but with The Elemental Planes and beyond, I look forward to working with much more fantastic art themes to compliment our distant engine. 
       On a planet called Ace a group of common-folk began to travel the astral planes. These prodigies brought to Ace wisdom and magic far beyond their time. They visited lands that alien races had long ago abandoned, mines deep within planets too hostile for surface life, and frozen landscapes that floated above unseen forces. The stories and artifacts they brought back with them seemed to usher in the start of a golden age of wisdom and adventure.
     One prodigy however was deceived by his own curiosity, as he traveled deeper and deeper into realms not meant for mankind. His name was Foridal of Garreath, the Northern most kingdom of Ace. Though he believed his actions of good nature, he brought nothing but sorrow and misery to his people. The snows of the North spread further with each passing year, as Foridal's following silently grew. Communication with Garreath was eventually abandoned to horror stories of sacrifice and ritual.
     The Students, a group formed under the tutelage of the prodigies, was to stand against Foridal and his Blood Cult. Fearing for all life, you travel to the City of Time to join their cause. As is ritual for all newcomers you are brought before the Core Shard, a giant crystal said to reach to the very heart of the planet. When touched Students are bound to the Core Shard, allowing them to return from their astral studies no matter how far they may wander.
     Reaching your hand forward you touch the Shard. A deep purple light surrounds your body as the instructor nearby gasps. You see his face, eyes spread wide in surprise, as the world around you folds onto itself. Seasons flash by, images of space, lands you have never visited, colors you have never seen. Then all is black.
     And then, you smell grass. You feel warm. Your face rests on bare earth. Opening your eyes you stand up. Your clothes are missing, yet you are unharmed. The sun shines warm on your skin. A breeze sways the leaves of the trees nearby. There are no buildings nor people you can see, only lush green, a lake in the distance, snow peaked mountains on the horizon.
     A crystal the same purple as the Core Shard of Ace pulses from several steps away, this one just taller than you, wide as a palm trunk. Without sound or movement it somehow beckons you. You hear only birds and the wind. As you approach the crystal slowly, words come into your mind.
     "This is not your planet. You are not what you were. You must grow. You must find yourself. You must save the Multiverse." The pulsing fades, though you can sense the crystal is somehow alive.
     The expected alpha release delivery date is three months. After that, online sales should be enough to support the project. Game development is however not without unforeseen problems, and selling a broken version to the public is never a good idea. Thus, the below budget is calculated for six months of frugal spending.
     With full-time development funded I can be online every day answering community questions, taking in player input, posting updates, and everything that a transparent developer should do. Any funding beyond the minimum goal will primarily be used to contract artists around the world for more original game content including equipment models, monsters, environments, music, and more.
     The rewards are heavily targeted at letting backers become a permanent part of Solace Crafting. Want to get your voice in? Your favorite quote? Your cat's name? Don't see something you think should be in the rewards? Let me know!
     Don't forget you can absolutely pledge a custom amount to buy multiple rewards. If you're confused on how to do that, just let me know and I'll be glad to help.
     In general all content must be of a good and positive nature, and be more or less fit into a classic fantasy setting:
No sexually explicit content
No gore or blood
No swear words, or overly offensive language
No reference to any real-world groups or individuals, past or present
No guns, steampunk, or modern technology
Nothing too silly like a big halibut for a sword
English and Japanese only (for now)
All content must be entirely original work, and forfeit all intellectual property rights
Anything of a 3D nature can be submitted as a sketch or even just a description
All content submitted in digital format is subject to alteration
     Unless anonymity is requested, all backer and community content will include the artists name or nickname in-game (when possible) and on our website.
Poem: around 10-50 words
Short Story: less than 2000 characters
Champion & Hero: name and saying
Townsperson: name, saying, and appearance
Astral Prodigy: name, saying, and appearance
     -Steam Achievement for finding you in-game
Quest NPC: name, saying, and appearance
    -Quest line of up to four steps with reward
Boss: Full customization (attacks, area, story, etc)
     Any support for Solace Crafting is supporting not only my passion and dream of a better crafting and building heavy RPG, but also my vision of a gaming studio that promotes sportsmanship, community, and creative team PvE content. Whether the campaign fails or raises a million dollars I will continue to pour my heart and soul into building a like-minded online community.
     I'm sure there are many unforeseen trials ahead, and I am certain that I will not have to face them alone thanks to the love and support I have received on my now five year journey into game development.
     Please feel free to contact me via the comments, social media, or our website if you need any assurance that I am in this for the long run. Thank you for reading to the end, and I hope you've found an interest in what I'm working on.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There is no risk of Solace Crafting not being delivered. The game already has a fully functional build, live and frequently updating on Steam for testers.
 Unforeseen delays are certainly possible, that's why the budget is calculated at six months instead of my goal of three. I am prioritizing a functional, optimized, and bug free game instead of AAA graphics and animations.
 Due to the nature of Solace Crafting, multiplayer is the largest challenge on the horizon. Initial releases will be focused on single player until a content rich experience has been achieved.
